results.title: Raiders of the lost ark
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford immortalised the character of thrillseeker archaeologist Indiana Jones in this first of the series. From the opening sequence filled with huge crawling tarantulas, golden idols and giant rolling stones, “Raiders of the lost ark” is a rollercoaster of thrills and action. Jones is on a mission to find the missing Lost Ark of the Covenant and encounters evil Nazi’s, slithering snakes, mummified bodies and red tape before he achieves his mission. Co-starring Karen Allen and Denholm Elliott. A great movie from master blockbuster filmmakers George Lucas and Steven Spielberg.

results.title: Racing silver: German Motorracing 1900-1971
results.creator_credit: Michael J. Churchill, Neville Hay and Duke Marketing
results.brief_description: Motoring authority Neville Hay takes a fascinating journey through the archives of Mercedes Benz and Auto Union from 1900 to the late 1960s. We also take a look at Porsche and BMW as he sheds light on the innovative design, construction and magnificent drivers (such as Fangio, Moss, Caracciola, Lang and Nuvolari) which brought these manufacturers extraordinary success in Grand Prix and sports car racing during those years.

results.title: Racing red: great Italian racing cars
results.brief_description: From the beginnings of racing the Italians have been passionately involved with designing, building and racing motor cars in their national racing colour of brilliant red. Famous car makes such as Fiat, Alfa Romeo, Maserati, Lancia and Ferrari all illustrate the appeal of these exotic machines, from the era before cars were covered in commercial sponsorship. Rare archival footage from the start of the century until the mid-70’s complements modern day footage, and automobile authority Neville Hay provides commentary and anecdotes from his vast experience in motor racing.

results.title: Racing green: Great British racing cars of the 50's and 60's
results.brief_description: Revisit many lovingly restored examples of the great British racing cars (such as Aston Martin, Jaguar, BRM, Lotus, Cooper, Connaught and Vanwall) of the 50’s and 60’s in action again at the world’s leading historic racing car festival at Silverstone, UK. The great names of the past including Moss, Brabham, Salvadori, Brooks and Innes Ireland are reunited with the cars in which they earned their reputations and many international victories. Present day action footage of the cars and drivers is combined with rare archival footage from the original era as each car is expertly profiled. Automobile authority Neville Hay adds many anecdotes from his experience and knowledge of motor racing history.

results.title: Raftsmen = Fazi ke
results.creator_credit: Tang Baoliang, Yao Shougang and Xi'an Film Studio
results.brief_description:
The story took place in the 1940s in northwestern China, where a group of Yellow River raftsmen tried to save a girl from the bandits. Bandit chief, Gesi, abducted Xinghua to be his concubine. Xinghua ran away on the wedding day and was saved by a raftsman of the lower river, Tieniu. Gesi incited hatred between the upper river and lower river raftsmen by giving all his rafts to the upper river raftsmen. The Master of the lower river raftsmen stopped a fight between the upper river and lower river raftsmen and two groups reconciled. Xinghua went back to Gesi so that he would not make more trouble for the raftsmen. However, Tieniu’s swear brother, Shitou fought with Gesi and saved Xinghua. In the fight, Gesi fell off from a cliff and Shitou was badly hurt. Xinghua fell in love with Shitou, who thought that his brother Tieniu should marry her. The Master decided that Xinghua should put a coin in the cake and the one who had the coin should marry Xinghua. To Xinghua’s surprise, both denied having had the coin. Later, Shitou died in an incident and Xinghua found the coin on him. At Shitou’s funeral by the Yellow River, Gesi came with a group of bandits. The Master broke a cursed rule by carrying a woman on the raft. It’s said that this would bring back luck. But Xinghua left safely with the raftsmen at the end.

Sheepskin rafting used to be a means of transport on the Yellow River before the 1980s. The film allows the audience to have an idea about the hard life of the raftsmen there before China’s liberation in 1949.
Established in 1958, Xi’an Film Studio is a major film studio in China. It became the cradle of New Chinese Cinema in the early 1980s by encouraging experimental filmmaking. China’s well-known director, Zhang Yimou’s first internationally acclaimed film “Red Sorghum” was produced by Xi’an Film Studio. This is a film for anyone interested in China’s Yellow River and the sheepskin rafting there. Music of the film features northwestern folk songs. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Ra: the path of the sun god: a vision of ancient Egypt
results.creator_credit: Lesley Keen, Jan Culik, Scottish Film Production Board, Channel Four and Persistent Vision
results.brief_description: A three part program which combines traditional animation techniques with special optical effects to produce a dream-like evocation of ancient Egyptian beliefs about the Creation and man’s place within it. The use of symbols to recreate the mental and spiritual world of the ancient Egyptians, transports the viewer to a zone which has more in common with Jung than popular notions of the ancient Egyptians. The parts are: “Dawn: the Creation”; “Noon: the year of the king” and “Night: the gates of the underworld”.

results.title: Mary's Story
results.creator_credit: Mary Herbert and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
Mary tells of her personal experience living with cerebral palsy. She recounts being told she could never walk, but her parents, determined that she could, helped her achieve this milestone. Mary goes on to speak about the troubles she has faced later in life.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: Radiation
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From a sun-drenched bathing beach to an awesome “gamma garden,” this film explores how heat, radio waves, x-rays and gamma rays affect various forms of life. It takes you to the radiological department of a modern hospital, to Canada’s atomic research center at Chalk River, and to the Brookhaven National Laboratory in the United States, where plant growth is subjected to gamma radiation.

results.title: The Next Chapter
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Craig Dawson
results.brief_description:
Craig Dawson shares his personal experience of being diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis, a disease that his grandmother also suffered from. Craig dedicates this story to her.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.
